v.

Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued March 7, 1980.
Decided May 30, 1980.
*92 *93 Robert E. Colville, Dist. Atty., Robert L. Eberhardt, Deputy Dist. Atty., Charles W. Johns, Asst. Dist. Atty., Pittsburgh, for appellant.
Carl Max Janavitz, Janavitz, Janavitz & Kanfoush, Rochelle D. Friedman, Pittsburgh, for appellees.

Before EAGEN, C.J., and O'BRIEN, ROBERTS, NIX, LARSEN, FLAHERTY and KAUFFMAN, JJ.

OPINION OF THE COURT
FLAHERTY, Justice.
This is an appeal from an Order of the Court of Common Pleas of Allegheny County granting appellees' Motion to Quash an Information on the ground that the Voluntary Deviate Sexual Intercourse Statute[1] is unconstitutional.[2]*94 Appellees were arrested at an "adult" pornographic *95 theater on charges of voluntary deviate sexual intercourse and/or conspiracy to perform the same.
